intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium submirum, commonly known as the ghostly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, often with a subtle, almost ethereal appearance. Hieracium submirum is known for its delicate, sprawling growth habit and its ability to thrive in temperate climates.
